title: Stable Outcomes and Information in Games: An Empirical Framework. (arXiv:2205.04990v2 [econ.EM] UPDATED)
abstract: Empirically, many strategic settings are characterized by stable outcomes in which players' decisions are publicly observed, yet no player takes the opportunity to deviate. To analyze such situations in the presence of incomplete information, we build an empirical framework by introducing a novel solution concept that we call Bayes stable equilibrium. Our framework allows the researcher to be agnostic about players' information and the equilibrium selection rule. The Bayes stable equilibrium identified set collapses to the complete information pure strategy Nash equilibrium identified set under strong assumptions on players' information. Furthermore, all else equal, it is weakly tighter than the Bayes correlated equilibrium identified set. We also propose computationally tractable approaches for estimation and inference. translated_title: 游戏中的稳定结果与信息：一个实证框架
translated_abstract: 在许多战略环境中，稳定的结果通常具有公开可见的玩家决策，但没有玩家抓住机会进行偏离。为了分析这种存在不完全信息的情况，我们引入了一种新颖的解概念——贝叶斯稳定均衡作为实证框架。我们的框架允许研究者对玩家的信息和均衡选择规则保持不可知状态。在玩家信息存在强假设的情况下，贝叶斯稳定均衡确定集会收缩到完全信息纯策略纳什均衡确定集中。此外，在其他因素相等的情况下，它比贝叶斯相关均衡确定集更紧。我们还提出了可计算的估计和推断方法。在一个应用中，我们研究了麦当劳和汉堡王在美国的战略进入决策。我们的研究结果突出了信息假设在游戏中的识别力，并提供了有关快餐行业竞争动态的新见解。
tldr: 本论文提出了一种贝叶斯稳定均衡的实证框架，可用于分析存在不完全信息的稳定结果。此框架强于贝叶斯相关均衡确定集，并在麦当劳和汉堡王的竞争研究中得到了应用。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes an empirical framework of Bayes stable equilibrium to analyze stable outcomes in games with incomplete information. The framework is more powerful than Bayes correlated equilibrium identified set and is applied to study the strategic competition between McDonald's and Burger King.
